intro: Tournefortia setifera, commonly known as the slender tournefortia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy yellow flowers with five petals. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in coastal areas or sandy soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in both horticulture and ecological research.
